cs.ualberta.conditionlog.model
Class DatabaseDeletionAdapter

java.lang.Object
  cs.ualberta.conditionlog.model.DatabaseAdapter
      cs.ualberta.conditionlog.model.DatabaseDeletionAdapter

public class DatabaseDeletionAdapter
extends DatabaseAdapter

Contains methods for deleting entries to the database. It inherits the open() and close() methods from DatabaseAdapter, which are used in the same way.

Author:
tgriffit

Constructor Detail

DatabaseDeletionAdapter

public DatabaseDeletionAdapter(Context context)
Method Detail

deleteCondition

public void deleteCondition(java.lang.String cond)
Removes all lines associated condition from the conditions table. The photos still exist, and can still be associated with tags, but will not be found by searching for condition.

Parameters:
cond - - the condition to remove.

deleteTag

public void deleteTag(java.lang.String tag)
Removes all lines associated with a tag from the tags table.

Parameters:
tag -

deleteConditionFromPhoto

public void deleteConditionFromPhoto(java.lang.String filename,
                                     java.lang.String cond)
Removes a condition from the given photo. There is a database trigger to ensure that this will not completely delete the condition.

Parameters:
filename -
cond -

deleteTagFromPhoto

public void deleteTagFromPhoto(java.lang.String filename,
                               java.lang.String tag)
Removes a tag from the given photo. If no more photos have that tag, the tag no longer exists.

Parameters:
filename -
tag -

deletePhoto

public void deletePhoto(java.lang.String filename)
Deletes a photo from the photos table and removes all instances of it from the conditions and tags tables. There is a trigger in the database that prevents a condition from being deleted when its last photo is deleted.

Parameters:
filename -

deletePassword

public void deletePassword()
Clears the password table. Used for testing purposes.
